metadata.title: CVE-2019-2910 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Security: Encryption). Supported versions that are affected are5.6.45 and prior and 5.7.27 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerabilityallows unauthenticated attacker with network access via multiple protocolsto compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized read access to a subset of MySQL Server accessibledata. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 3.7 (Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2910` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-client - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-common - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-server - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
mariadb-10.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
